data.title: 15 Of The Best Space Movies To Watch Now And Where They Are Streaming
data.meta_description: The best space movies often involve sinister concepts or a conflict between forces and/or planets. Find a list and streaming details here.
data.text:
Whether it involves a trip to the moon, or problem solving when the trajectory to a destination doesn’t work out, or a whole different world that fictionalizes space, space movies is a broad category. In this roundup, Deadline focuses on movies set in space, and while not listed in the gallery, the Star Wars, Star Trek and Alien franchises cannot go unnamed.

Greg Berlanti’s Fly Me To the Moon is the latest film to cover the moon landing, thugh it is set on Earth in addition to in space. Other films worth the watch include Hidden Figures (2016), Aliens in the Attic (2009), Space Jam (1996) and more.

From classic depictions of the realm we know the least about to mind-bending stories of how to save our planet, here are fifteen of the best space movies and where they are streaming or available for rent.

RELATED: Down From Record 15 Series To 6 On Air, Greg Berlanti Talks Peak TV Demise, Strikes, Scooby-Doo & That Scarlett Johansson-Channing Tatum Chemistry In ‘Fly Me To The Moon’ – The Deadline Q&A

A TRIP TO THE MOON, 1902

Dated 1902, the first ever film on space travel with Georges Méliès taking inspiration from a myriad of sources including the work of Jules Verne. You can watch the full version on YouTube, and it is also streaming on Max. – Melanie Goodfellow

2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY (1968)

Directed by Stanley Kubrick, this 1968 Oscar winner is a must-watch for any cinephile worth their salt, as a landmark film for science fiction, grappling with themes like AI that are even more resonant now than when the film premiered. Recently tributed by Greta Gerwig in the highly memorable opening sequence of Barbie, 2001 looks at the evolution of the human race over millions of years, starting with a prehistoric encounter with a mysterious monolith. The film is available to stream on Max. – Matt Grobar

BARBARELLA (1968)

The original Barbarella (1968) starring Jane Fonda, John Phillip Law, Anita Pallenberg and Mil O’Shea in addition to others involves the top secret mission of Barbarella (Fonda) to stop The Great Tyrant (Pallenberg) and her Concierge (O’Shea) who threaten to make space evil once more. Sydney Sweeney is set to star in a remake of the film with Edgar Wright in talks to direct and a potential script from Jane Goldman and Honey Ross. Barbarella is available to rent on Apple TV+. – Dessi Gomez

MOONRAKER (1979)

This is Roger Moore’s fourth James Bond movie, and a favorite of many, that happens to be set in space. Lois Chiles, Michael Lonsdale, Richard Kiel and more star in the galactic action film. Moonraker is available to rent on Apple TV+ and Prime Video as well as Fandango at Home.

SOLARIS (1972)

Solaris shows a more sinister side of space as a psychologist gets sent to a space station orbiting a distant planet to figure out why the crew has lost their minds. The thrilling film is available to stream on Max. – Dessi Gomez

SPACEBALLS (1987)

Given the recent news of a sequel to team Josh Gad, Mel Brooks, and director Josh Greenbaum, there can be no greater time to revisit this classic parody co-written, directed and produced by Brooks. Lampooning space operas, and the Star Wars franchise in particular, the film follows the adventures of the mercenary Lone Starr and his sidekick Barf as they attempt to rescue Princess Vespa from the evil clutches of Dark Helmet and the sinister Spaceballs, who are plotting to steal all the air from her home planet. Bill Pullman, John Candy, and Daphne Zuniga were among the stars of this beloved send-up of sci-fi tropes. Spaceballs is available to stream on Max. – Matt Grobar

DUNE (1984)

David Lynch’s space movie set the tone for the stunningly visual remakes starring Timothée Chalamet, Zendaya and Austin Butler and Florence Pugh in Dune: Part 2 (2024). Before Chalamet, Kyle MacLachlan donned the role of Paul Atreides, and Francesca Annis played Lady Jessica ahead of Rebecca Ferguson. Virginia Madsen (pictured) starred as Princess Irulan, who is played by Florence Pugh in Denis Villeneuve’s newer version. This version of Dune is only available to rent on Apple TV+, but Villeneuve’s two films are streaming on Max.

APOLLO 13 (1995)

The 1995 blockbuster from Ron Howard starring Tom Hanks, (pictured second from left alongside Bill Paxton, Gary Sinise and Kevin Bacon) is not only one of the great space travel movies but one of the great thrill rides of the 90s. The film, which told the true life story of how NASA made a heroic effort to bring Apollo 13 back to earth safely, not only smashed box-office records, it would also go on to land seven Oscar nominations including Best Picture. Apollo 13 is available to rent on Apple TV+, Prime Video, Fandango at Home and more. – Justin Kroll

FROM EARTH TO THE MOON (1998)

Before HBO and Playtone captivated us with its World War II mini-series ‘Band of Brothers,’ they were blowing audiences minds with this 1998 NASA origin tale. The scope and attention to detail to this incredible story set the stage for those groundbreaking mini-series HBO is known for while also giving us a detail story of how the space race came to be. Yes, this one’s technically a miniseries, but it deserves to be in here. The series is available to stream on Max. – Justin Kroll

WALL-E (2008)

Pixar’s take on a love story between two robots gives hope for the future and climate change as Wall-E — a trash-cube maker, holds onto a sapling sprouting in a boot for Eve (Extra-Terrestrial Vegetation Evaluator). Hopefully we don’t get to the point where this film’s premise becomes a reality. Wall-E is streaming on Disney+. – Dessi Gomez

GRAVITY (2013)

Before Christopher Nolan’s Interstellar, there was Alfonso Cuaron’s Gravity, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney. The thrilling feature film won seven Oscars. Gravity is available to rent on Apple TV+, Prime Video, Fandango at Home and more. – Dessi Gomez

INTERSTELLAR (2014)

Anne Hathaway, Matthew McConaughey, Jessica Chastain, a young Timothée Chalamet, David Oyelowo, John Lithgow, Michael Caine, Matt Damon and more make this star-studded space film one to watch as McConaughey’s Joseph Cooper and Hathaway’s Brand sacrifice much of their loved one’s life spans to search for a new planet for humanity once earth is no longer uninhabitable. Interstellar is available to stream on Prime Video, MGM+ and Paramount+. – Dessi Gomez

THE MARTIAN (2015)

Matt Damon and Jessica Chastain also starred in The Martian (2015) from Ridley Scott, and Damon plays another stranded astronaut, this time on Mars. Kristen Wiig, Kate Mara, Michael Peña, Sean Bean, Jeff Daniels, Sebastian Stan, Chiwetel Ejiofor and more appear in the fictional film that follows the attempt to get Damon’s Mark Watney home safely. The Martian is available to rent on Apple TV+, Prime Video, Fandango at Home and more. – Dessi Gomez

PROXIMA (2019)

Eva Green stars as woman preparing for one year mission on the International Space Station and grappling with the challenge of leaving her young daughter behind. Drama by Alice Winocour also features Matt Dillon, Sandra Hüller and Lars Eidinger in the cast. Proxima is available to rent on Apple TV+ – Melanie Goodfellow

MOONSHOT (2022)

Cole Sprouse and Lana Condor star in HBO’s Moonshot, in which Condor portrays Sophie, a smart girl who wants nothing more than to go to space to reunite with her long distance boyfriend Calvin (Mason Gooding), but she meets Walt (Sprouse) along the way as he hitches a ride in the spaceship. Walt has applied to the program Sophie got into over and over again, so he had to take things into his own hands. Zach Braff, Lukas Gage, Michelle Buteau and Cameron Esposito also appear in the space-set rom com. Moonshot is available for rent on Prime Video, Apple TV+, Fandango at Home and more. – Dessi Gomez
